page.title: 09May Queen Festival
page.content: The Lymm May Queen Festival orignated in 1889 when the Lymm and Oughtrington Band of Hope held their first festival in the village.The actual purpose of the festival is veiled in the passage of time but is more likely akin to the walking-days of Lancashire with a subsequent field-day for the children of the Band of Hope and Churches.The festival lapsed in 1935 and was revived by a group of enthusiasts in 1947 and has been held every year since then.The queens were originally chosen from the chapels,in rotation and the present method follows the pattern except that the four wards are now used.Monies raised on the route of the procession are given to local charities while the money raised on the field helps to offset the cost of staging the festival.
